content:
• Friday, August 17, 2012
  • LPHI

    A Texas judge declines a request by state regulators to immediately appoint a receiver over Life...

    A Texas judge declines a request by state regulators to immediately appoint a receiver over Life Partners Holdings (LPHI -17.6%) but says the regulators were "likely to prevail" in claims the company committed fraud in connection with its business of selling life insurance investments. LPHI -2% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:42 PM

  • Apple's 1.7% climb today pushes the stock to a new all-time record ($646.98 currently), and the...

    Apple's 1.7% climb today pushes the stock to a new all-time record ($646.98 currently), and the market cap above $600B for the first time. As good an excuse for buying as any, speculation grows the company has begun production on an iPad Mini as well as the iTV.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:48 PM | 4 Comments
  • CKP

    Checkpoint Systems (CKP +21.1%) shares have powered steadily higher through the day after Joe...

    Checkpoint Systems (CKP +21.1%) shares have powered steadily higher through the day after Joe Terranova told a CNBC audience last night that the maker of electronic security products could be a merger or acquisition target.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:32 PM | 1 Comment
  • FST

    Forest Oil's (FST +4.4%) spike in the past hour is attributed to speculation of potential...

    Forest Oil's (FST +4.4%) spike in the past hour is attributed to speculation of potential takeover interest. The exploration and production company has been plagued by a string of earnings and revenue misses, plus defections of top management.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:18 PM | 1 Comment
  • CRMT

    America's Car-Mart (CRMT -3.6%) slides after missing FQ1 estimates this morning. Net profit...

    America's Car-Mart (CRMT -3.6%) slides after missing FQ1 estimates this morning. Net profit edged down 2% as the used-car seller set aside more for credit losses, masking an increase in sales. Gross margin widened to 48.9% from 48.7%, but was largely offset by provisions for credit losses, which jumped 17% from a year earlier.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:05 PM
  • CAT

    Workers at Caterpillar's (CAT +1.5%) Joliet, Ill., factory vote in favor of the company's new...

    Workers at Caterpillar's (CAT +1.5%) Joliet, Ill., factory vote in favor of the company's new pay offer, a move that will end a strike lasting more than five months.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:56 PM | 6 Comments
  • OPEN

    OpenTable (OPEN +4.1%) rallies thanks to a bullish note from Oppenheimer. After meeting with CFO...

    OpenTable (OPEN +4.1%) rallies thanks to a bullish note from Oppenheimer. After meeting with CFO Duncan Robertson several times, the firm sees several catalysts over the next 6-12 months. These include a re-acceleration of slumping U.K. reservation growth, higher U.S. bookings conversions thanks to an "increased focus on personalized user experiences and reviews," and the ability to beat lowered Street estimates.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:43 PM | 1 Comment
  • APKT

    Acme Packet (APKT -5.2%) slumps on a downgrade to Underperform from Raymond James. The firm...

    Acme Packet (APKT -5.2%) slumps on a downgrade to Underperform from Raymond James. The firm thinks AT&T and Verizon are delaying plans to support voice-over-LTE (VoLTE) on their 4G networks by at least 6 months. It believes Verizon might wait until 2014, and AT&T longer.. That's a negative for Acme, whose session border controllers handle VoLTE traffic, but not traditional voice traffic. AT&T and Verizon's soft capex has already led Acme to warn repeatedly over the last 12 months.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:32 PM
  • CKEC

    Carmike Cinemas (CKEC -1.1%) recovers a bit of the ground lost after shares spiked downward...

    Carmike Cinemas (CKEC -1.1%) recovers a bit of the ground lost after shares spiked downward following a report that the company received a bomb threat warning bombs may have been planted in theaters across the country. According to local reports, Carmike theaters are now being searched by police and bomb squads. [Update: Police say no bombs have been found]
     
     
     
     
    | 1:18 PM | 1 Comment
  • FNMA

    Can't get enough of the Treasury/GSE news? Behind the move, speculates ZH, is Tim Geithner's...

    Can't get enough of the Treasury/GSE news? Behind the move, speculates ZH, is Tim Geithner's fury at FHFA head DeMarco's snubbing of administration plans to impose principal reductions on mortgages ahead of the election. More? From the Treasury PR: "(This ends) the circular practice of the Treasury advancing funds to the GSEs simply to pay back dividends to Treasury." Did Treasury just admit it was running a Ponzi operation?

     
     
     
     
    | 12:56 PM | 6 Comments
  • SONC

    Sonic (SONC +4.1%) moves higher today after announcing earlier that its board has authorized a...

    Sonic (SONC +4.1%) moves higher today after announcing earlier that its board has authorized a stock repurchase program for up to $40M worth of common stock through August, 2013.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:45 PM
  • ANN

    Highlights from Ann's earnings CC: Positive consumer response to new styles helped limit...

    Highlights from Ann's earnings CC: Positive consumer response to new styles helped limit promotional activity, especially with the Loft brand. Increased traffic and a higher average order led e-commerce sales 29% higher with new enhancements to the firm's website also contributing to results. Striking into Canada in Q3, where the firm says its brand awareness is already strong. ANN +21.8% to $34.37, a 52-week high. (transcript, earnings)

     
     
     
     
    | 12:34 PM
  • PTIE

    Pain Therapeutics (PTIE +1.3%) moves up after being initiated with a Buy at C.K. Cooper. The...

    Pain Therapeutics (PTIE +1.3%) moves up after being initiated with a Buy at C.K. Cooper. The firm says it wants to stay ahead of an potentially positive news on Remoxy, its extended release capsules of oxycodone being developed with Pfizer (PFE -1.2%). The FDA rejected the drug in June, but Cooper believes the stock will move higher once PFE clarifies its plans for resubmission.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:22 PM
  • MCPIQ

    Molycorp (MCP -11.5%) nears session lows after pricing separate offerings of stock and debt...

    Molycorp (MCP -11.5%) nears session lows after pricing separate offerings of stock and debt totaling at least $480M, higher than first estimated. MCP is offering 12M shares at $10 each, which could total 13.8M shares if the underwriter exercises an option to purchase more. The $360M note offering would increase to $414M if the underwriters exercise an over-allotment option. (earlier)

     
     
     
     
    | 12:04 PM | 1 Comment
  • FICO

    Fair Isaac (FICO +1.4%), creator of the FICO credit score, acquires risk-management software...

    Fair Isaac (FICO +1.4%), creator of the FICO credit score, acquires risk-management software firm Adeptra for $115M in cash, giving the company a wider breadth of offerings in business-management services.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:01 PM
  • FB

    Facebook (FB -2.9%) sells off yet again - shares are down 9% since the company saw its first...

    Facebook (FB -2.9%) sells off yet again - shares are down 9% since the company saw its first lockup expire yesterday, and 49% from IPO levels. The potential impact of the decline on employee morale and retention hasn't been lost on Mark Zuckerberg, who reportedly acknowledged the issue at a company meeting this month. According to SecondMarket's data, anyone who has bought Facebook since Nov. 2010 is now underwater.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:52 AM | 8 Comments
  • MIG

    FBR raises its rating on alternative risk insurance company Meadowbrook Insurance (MIG +6.5%) to...

    FBR raises its rating on alternative risk insurance company Meadowbrook Insurance (MIG +6.5%) to Outperform from Market Perform with a $10 price target, citing lower reserve charges. Although MIG has been the worst-performing stock in FBR's insurance coverage, it now thinks the risk/reward going forward sets up well.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:49 AM
  • OPLK

    Oplink (OPLK +16.4%) soars after soundly beating FQ4 EPS estimates thanks to a 370 bps Q/Q...

    Oplink (OPLK +16.4%) soars after soundly beating FQ4 EPS estimates thanks to a 370 bps Q/Q increase in gross margin, and providing better-than-feared guidance. While Oplink's FQ1 revenue guidance range of $43M-$46M is below a $46.2M consensus, EPS guidance of $0.16-$0.22 is in-line with a $0.19 consensus. Optical component rival JDS Uniphase (JDSU +0.7%) rallied on Wednesday after posting earnings. Up in sympathy: FNSR +3.6%. NPTN +6%.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:36 AM
  • ANTM

    WellPoint (WLP -1.4%) dips after Morgan Stanley cut the shares to Equal-Weight this morning. The...

    WellPoint (WLP -1.4%) dips after Morgan Stanley cut the shares to Equal-Weight this morning. The firm says it's facing more pressure from an unfavorable mix of commercial health-insurance prices and medical costs, and its "risk-reward looks less compelling" than that of its peers. WLP cut FY12 guidance last month due to waning membership, and Morgan sees that that trend continuing over the second half as well.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:34 AM
  • KKD

    Shares of Krispy Kreme Doughnuts (KKD +4.6%) run up a gain after landing an initiation from...

    Shares of Krispy Kreme Doughnuts (KKD +4.6%) run up a gain after landing an initiation from Wedbush at Outperform to go along with the firm's lush price target of $9 on the stock. Next week the company reports Q2 earnings (preview).

     
     
     
     
    | 11:21 AM
  • MCK

    Drug wholesaler McKesson (MCK -2.5%) is one of the S&P 500's biggest decliners today, hit by...

    Drug wholesaler McKesson (MCK -2.5%) is one of the S&P 500's biggest decliners today, hit by a valuation downgrade to Equal-weight by Morgan Stanley. The firm says earnings look "flattish" next year due to fewer new exclusive generics, and any EPS growth would simply be the result of stock buybacks instead of meaningful sales. It adds that with no new catalysts over the near term, the upside looks limited.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:07 AM

  • Eastman Kodak (EKDKQ.PK -9.8%) is thinking twice about selling its patent portfolio, after...

    Eastman Kodak (EKDKQ.PK -9.8%) is thinking twice about selling its patent portfolio, after initial bids came in well below expectations. The bankrupt former camera giant now says it "may retain all or parts of it as a source of creditor recoveries." On Monday, Kodak extended the deadline for patent bids. Is the patent bubble bursting?
     
     
     
     
    | 10:40 AM | 2 Comments
  • FCEL

    FuelCell Energy (FCEL -1.9%) is initiated at Market Perform with a $1.50 price target by...

    FuelCell Energy (FCEL -1.9%) is initiated at Market Perform with a $1.50 price target by FBR Capital, which likes longer-term prospects stemming from recent improvements in FCEL's product and service solution offerings, coupled with marketing and cost-control initiatives under a new CEO. Still, the firm is mindful that near-term sentiment does not favor microcap renewable power companies.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:35 AM | 1 Comment
  • GPS

    Canaccord Genuity keeps a bearish stance in place on Gap (GPS +4.8%) following the retailer's Q2...

    Canaccord Genuity keeps a bearish stance in place on Gap (GPS +4.8%) following the retailer's Q2 earnings report (I, II), reiterating a Sell rating. Analyst Laura Champine calls shares "overbought" and has pressing concerns on H2 margins.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:31 AM
  • MRVL

    Marvell's (MRVL -15.6%) FQ2 miss isn't sitting well with Cowen: the firm thinks management...

    Marvell's (MRVL -15.6%) FQ2 miss isn't sitting well with Cowen: the firm thinks management should have warned, and argues investors should wait for business to stabilize before buying. During its earnings call, Marvell partly blamed "increased competition" in the market for TD-SCDMA baseband chips (used in phones running on China Mobile's 3G network) for its miss - Marvell's main competitors in this space are Spreadtrum, Qualcomm, and MediaTek. (FQ3 guidance)

     
     
     
     
    | 10:21 AM | 1 Comment
  • RL

    Shares of Ralph Lauren (RL +3.0%) and Fossil (FOSL +2.7%) are two of the strongest gainers in...

    Shares of Ralph Lauren (RL +3.0%) and Fossil (FOSL +2.7%) are two of the strongest gainers in the retail sector off of a better-than-expected reading on consumer confidence. A report from China that indicates luxury spending could be broadening out to include younger consumers may also be helping to tip sentiment.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:17 AM
  • LULU

    Shares of Lululemon (LULU +1.4%) poke out an early gain. The action on LULU is dominated by...

    Shares of Lululemon (LULU +1.4%) poke out an early gain. The action on LULU is dominated by options activity, according to Schaeffer's Investment Research. At the moment, short-term speculators are extremely put-heavy.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:01 AM
  • GRPN

    Groupon (GRPN -5%) tumbles below $5 after Evercore's Ken Sena downgrades shares for the second...

    Groupon (GRPN -5%) tumbles below $5 after Evercore's Ken Sena downgrades shares for the second time in less than a month (previous). Now rating Groupon an Underweight, Sena forecasts the company will post 2013 EBITDA of $260M, well below a $470M consensus. He also sees the potential for further cash burn if billings continue to decline. Groupon has now fallen 37% since posting its Q2 report.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:54 AM | 6 Comments
  • PSTI

    Pluristem Therapeutics (PSTI +4.2%) enjoys continued upward momentum after Thursday's news that...

    Pluristem Therapeutics (PSTI +4.2%) enjoys continued upward momentum after Thursday's news that it received permission from India's health ministry to proceed with a Phase II clinical trial for the treatment of Buerger's disease. The trial could be followed by a larger multi-national Phase III. Shares popped 10% yesterday on the announcement.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:34 AM | 3 Comments
  • GTATQ

    GT Advanced Technologies (GTAT) +2.8% after Canaccord upgrades to Buy and lifts its PT to $9....

    GT Advanced Technologies (GTAT) +2.8% after Canaccord upgrades to Buy and lifts its PT to $9. Shares rallied yesterday following a positive earnings report from Meyer Burger, a Swiss maker of solar manufacturing equipment.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:24 AM
  • NOK

    Nokia (NYSE:NOK) and Zynga (NASDAQ:ZNGA), two tech companies having less-than-memorable years,...

    Nokia (NYSE:NOK) and Zynga (NASDAQ:ZNGA), two tech companies having less-than-memorable years, have formed a partnership. Zynga Poker and Draw Something will be pre-installed on Nokia's popular Asha feature phones. Draw Something, the result of Zynga's ~$210M acquisition of OMGPOP, has been seeing declining user activity. In June, Zynga promised to develop games for Windows Phone hardware such as Nokia's Lumia line. Nokia +4.9% after rallying on European exchanges.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:18 AM | 8 Comments
  • ARCC

    Ares Capital (NASDAQ:ARCC) prices (and increases the size of) its secondary offering. The sale...

    Ares Capital (NASDAQ:ARCC) prices (and increases the size of) its secondary offering. The sale will be for 22.5M shares (vs. 19M announced last night) with an option granted to underwriters to purchase another 3.375M (vs. 2.85M from last night). The price was not disclosed. Shares -3.5% premarket. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 9:16 AM | 2 Comments
  • ANN

    Premarket gainers: ANN +15%. PSTI +7%. OTC:ASTI +6%. IDIX +6%. VRNG +5%. Losers: IO -17%. MCP...

    Premarket gainers: ANN +15%. PSTI +7%. OTC:ASTI +6%. IDIX +6%. VRNG +5%.
    Losers: IO -17%. MCP -11%. MRVL -9%. VVUS -7%. ARO -5%.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:10 AM
  • IDIX

    Idenix Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:IDIX) +5.1% premarket as Brean Murray upgrades shares to Hold...

    Idenix Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:IDIX) +5.1% premarket as Brean Murray upgrades shares to Hold from Sell following yesterday's sharp decline after the FDA's placement of a clinical hold on its hepatitis C treatment. Leerink Swann maintains its Outperform rating, believing the clinical hold feels more like a precaution than a disaster.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:02 AM
  • ANN

    Shares of Ann (NYSE:ANN) soar 13.2% premarket off of the firm's smashing Q2 report that caught...

    Shares of Ann (NYSE:ANN) soar 13.2% premarket off of the firm's smashing Q2 report that caught analysts by surprise. Both the Ann Taylor and Loft brands clocked strong comparable-store sales gains, while e-commerce channels also performed well against the collective wisdom of critics that maintained Ann shoppers needed some touchy-feely before buying.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:51 AM
  • VVUS

    Vivus (NASDAQ:VVUS) -6.2% premarket after Jefferies downgrades shares to Underperform, citing...

    Vivus (NASDAQ:VVUS) -6.2% premarket after Jefferies downgrades shares to Underperform, citing generic competition. While investors have been concerned about patents for the weight-loss drug Qsymia, the firm thinks doctors may choose to prescribe generics since branded Qsymia is unlikely to be covered by payors and the two generics will be more affordable for patients.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:50 AM | 22 Comments
  • MCPIQ

    Molycorp (MCP) -9.3% premarket after yesterday's 7.5% drubbing following news of its offering....

    Molycorp (MCP) -9.3% premarket after yesterday's 7.5% drubbing following news of its offering. Dahlman Rose downgrades shares to Hold from Buy, as the size of the offering raises questions whether MCP's Mountain Pass project will be completed in the forecast timeframe. The firm cuts 2012 and 2013 EPS to $0.80 and $1.20, respectively, from its earlier $1.70 and $3.50.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:35 AM | 3 Comments
  • IO

    Ion Geophysical (NYSE:IO) says it will pursue all legal options after a Texas district court...

    Ion Geophysical (NYSE:IO) says it will pursue all legal options after a Texas district court jury ruled it should pay $105.9M in damages to WesternGeco, a geophysical services provider, for infringing patents related to control systems for marine seismic streamer steering devices. IO -14.5% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:22 AM
  • GPS

    Highlights from Gap's (NYSE:GPS) earnings CC: Sees continued top line growth with healthy...

    Highlights from Gap's (NYSE:GPS) earnings CC: Sees continued top line growth with healthy merchandise margins. CEO Glenn Murphy says marketing investments paid off, with online and social media leading to near-immediate boosts in product demand. Reports traffic at outlets stores is strong. Execs say the company will stick with its goal to open 30 stores in China and test the reaction to its brands before jumping in full force. GPS +2% premarket. (transcript)

     
     
     
     
    | 8:13 AM | 1 Comment

  • EU stocks track Wall St. and Asia and open higher, buoyed by Angela Merkel's "everything we can"...

    EU stocks track Wall St. and Asia and open higher, buoyed by Angela Merkel's "everything we can" to save the euro spiel, although Alpari's James Hughes isn't convinced. "The markets are always very quick to react to comments made by Merkel and it's regularly followed quickly by a reversal once the details...emerge." EU Stoxx 50 +0.4%, London +0.3%, Paris +0.2%, Frankfurt +0.4%, Madrid +1.5%, Milan +0.75%.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:51 AM

  • Asian shares mostly rise, supported by Angela Merkel saying Germany is "committed to doing...

    Asian shares mostly rise, supported by Angela Merkel saying Germany is "committed to doing everything we can" to maintain the euro, and more decent economic data from the U.S. That's causing the dollar to strengthen against the yen, thereby boosting Japanese exporters. Japan +0.8%, Hong Kong +0.6%, China -0.4%, India +0.6%.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:47 AM | 1 Comment
